Description: Problem: The roadmap defines modules, but no enforceable interfaces. Scope: Create package layout and abstract interfaces for agents, mechanisms, metrics, and event schemas.
Acceptance Criteria: Directory structure matches roadmap modules; base interfaces compile with type hints; smoke run initializes all core modules.

Description: Problem: Common random numbers are required for fair treatment comparisons. Scope: Implement seeded stream manager with child streams per subsystem (latent, agents, latency, etc.).
Acceptance Criteria: Same seed reproduces identical event log and metrics; changing one subsystem stream does not perturb others; seed protocol is documented.

Summary: PT-003: Time engine and event model
Description: Problem: Simulation semantics are currently implicit. Scope: Implement clock plus typed events (news, order, fill, batch_clear, rfq_request, rfq_quote, rfq_accept).
Acceptance Criteria: Event ordering rules are codified and tested; timestamp precision and tie-break policy are explicit; replay from event log reconstructs state.

Description: Problem: Incorrect PnL/inventory accounting can invalidate conclusions. Scope: Build accounting engine and invariant test suite.
Acceptance Criteria: Cash/inventory/PnL reconciliation tests pass; zero-sum transfer checks pass per trade; failure reports isolate violating event IDs.

Summary: PT-005: Latent information process (p_t) + signal model
Description: Problem: Core information model exists on paper but not in code. Scope: Implement bounded log-odds process with noise and jumps and per-agent delayed/noisy observations.
Acceptance Criteria: p_t stays in [0,1]; jump/noise/mean-reversion toggles are configurable; signal delay/noise heterogeneity covered by tests.

Summary: PT-006: Metrics recorder and canonical output schema
Description: Problem: Metrics are listed, but output format is undefined. Scope: Implement mechanism-agnostic recorder and standardized result schema (per-run JSON/Parquet plus summary table).
Acceptance Criteria: Event log and derived metrics serialize with stable schema version; all non-negotiable metrics are emitted; one command generates run artifact bundle.

Description: Problem: Baseline mechanism needed before treatment comparisons. Scope: Continuous matching, queue state, partial fills, cancels, and queue-position-aware fills.
Acceptance Criteria: Price-time priority tests pass; queue position affects fill outcomes; crossed books/partials/cancel race edge cases are tested.

Summary: PT-008: Agent v1 implementations (MM, informed, noise)
Description: Problem: Comparative experiments need consistent strategy definitions. Scope: Implement v1 behavior specs with shared policy interfaces.
Acceptance Criteria: MM reservation/spread equations are configurable and implemented; informed trader thresholding/size scaling implemented; noise trader Poisson arrivals and random side/size implemented.

Description: Problem: Execution assumptions must be common across mechanisms. Scope: Implement configurable submission/ack/fill latency and explicit leakage model.
Acceptance Criteria: Latency distributions are parameterized and reproducible; leakage channels by mechanism are explicitly mapped; tests verify same primitive defaults across mechanisms.

Description: Problem: Need calibrated baseline where MM survives under low informed intensity. Scope: Build parameter search and diagnostics for survival region.
Acceptance Criteria: At least one stable parameter regime meeting survival criteria is found; calibration report includes chosen params and rationale; sensitivity to informed intensity and latency is included.

Description: Problem: Phase 1 roadmap requires benchmark outputs. Scope: Scenario definitions, Monte Carlo runner, and CI summaries for baseline contrasts.
Acceptance Criteria: Batched simulations run across defined grid; confidence intervals and effect sizes are reported; reproducible command is documented.

Description: Problem: Phase 2 requires auction clearing with configurable interval/allocation. Scope: Implement batch collection, uniform clearing, and tie/allocation policies.
Acceptance Criteria: Clearing price logic validated on deterministic fixtures; supports Delta sweep values in roadmap; allocation policy variants selectable in config.

Summary: PT-013: CLOB vs FBA parity test harness
Description: Problem: Comparisons are invalid without treatment parity checks. Scope: Add automated assertions for equality of all non-mechanism parameters between runs.
Acceptance Criteria: Run fails when parity contract is violated; logs exact differing config keys; integrated into runner preflight.

Description: Problem: Need treatment contrast across batch intervals. Scope: Execute Delta in {50,100,250,500,1000} with common seeds.
Acceptance Criteria: Produces AS loss/spread/fill delay/RMSE comparison tables; includes confidence intervals and significance notes; artifacts saved in versioned experiment folder.

Description: Problem: Phase 3 requires private quote/accept pipeline. Scope: Implement RFQ request, dealer response, TTL expiry, and acceptance path.
Acceptance Criteria: TTL and response latency are enforced; private information path follows leakage model; multi-dealer competition config is supported.

Description: Problem: Need protection versus price-discovery tradeoff measurement. Scope: Sweep TTL/latency/dealer competition and compare to baseline.
Acceptance Criteria: Tradeoff frontiers for key metrics are reported; includes confidence intervals and reproducibility metadata; contrasts use same seed sets as other mechanisms.

Description: Problem: Advanced mechanism should not begin before parity in earlier phases. Scope: Implement only if M1-M3 parity gates pass.
Acceptance Criteria: Gate check enforced in runner; separate buy/sell clears and no maker-maker matching implemented; comparative report generated only after gate satisfaction.

Summary: PT-018: Statistical power and Monte Carlo budget policy
Description: Problem: CIs are requested but minimum sample size/power targets are not specified. Scope: Define minimum run counts and stopping rules.
Acceptance Criteria: Policy for CI width targets is documented; runner can continue until precision criterion is met; reports include achieved precision diagnostics.

Summary: PT-019: Regression suite for mechanism sanity cases
Description: Problem: Roadmap mentions sanity checks but no permanent regression set. Scope: Encode deterministic scenario fixtures for each mechanism.
Acceptance Criteria: CI runs full sanity suite; golden outputs are versioned and diffed; failure triage points to changed invariants.

Description: Problem: Reproducibility depends on standardized execution workflow. Scope: Implement CLI for run/compare/report and concise runbook.
Acceptance Criteria: One command runs each phase; run metadata captures git SHA/config hash/seed set; runbook includes troubleshooting and expected runtime.

Summary: PT-039: Deterministic parallel Monte Carlo execution
Description: Problem: Larger sweep workloads are slow in single-process mode and discourage adequate repetition counts. Scope: Add process-level parallel execution for repetition/scenario batches while preserving deterministic seed partitioning and artifact reproducibility.
Acceptance Criteria: Runner supports configurable worker count; same config and seed set produce identical outputs regardless of worker count; failure handling/reporting is deterministic with per-worker run IDs; docs include parallel mode guidance and expected speedups.

Summary: PLAN-001: Define primary objective function and decision rule
Description: Issue found: roadmap lists many metrics but no explicit decision rule for 'better.' Scope: define primary endpoint and guardrail metrics for all phase reports.
Acceptance Criteria: Primary endpoint is documented (for example AS reduction at fixed fill-delay budget); reports include pass/fail against endpoint and guardrails.

Summary: PLAN-002: Canonical simulation time semantics and unit mapping
Description: Issue found: Delta marked as ms-equivalent without canonical conversion standard. Scope: define canonical time units and conversion for latency/batching.
Acceptance Criteria: Single canonical unit is defined and enforced in config; conversion functions are tested; all mechanism configs use shared time mapping utilities.

Summary: PLAN-003: Enforce strategy-freeze policy for phase comparisons
Description: Issue found: mechanism-specific MM adaptations may confound treatment effects if introduced too early. Scope: establish gating policy for strategy changes.
Acceptance Criteria: Phase comparison runs use common frozen strategy defaults; mechanism-specific adaptations require explicit post-baseline gate and changelog entry.
